New Records: Charlie Blackmon tied Carlos Gonzalez with 227 career home runs and reached 800 career RBIs.
Jake Cave hit his first MLB triple.
Aaron Schunk hit his first MLB single.
Ryan McMahon reached 100 RBIs for the season.
Key Match Events: Colorado Rockies scored five runs with two outs in the eighth inning to win the game.
Charlie Blackmon hit a two-run home run in the second inning.
St. Louis Cardinals defensive miscues led to Colorado's runs in the first and second innings.
Rockies' eighth-inning rally turned the game around after being down 8-5.
Post-Match Reflections: Charlie Blackmon praised the team's performance despite tough conditions and shadows.
Bud Black noted the team's resilience and late-game performance.
Rockies needed to avoid 100 losses and focused on the remaining series against the Dodgers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game's outcome was pivotal for Colorado's season momentum.
Charlie Blackmon's performance was significant in his final season.
Rockies' eighth-inning rally was a turning point in the game.
